human.summary: Temporal substrates model is rate-separation: fast states relax to an attracting manifold; slow variables encode long-horizon drift and memory.
bullets: Separate fast x and slow τ dynamics
Slow manifold M captures stable regimes
Recency/causality handled as constraints on τ evolution

definitions.definition: Minimal variable set representing the system for this DTU.
Constraint that must hold for feasibility/stability.

invariants: Updates preserve causality constraints (no future leakage)
claims: Time is an explicit state variable
Verification reduces to manifold distance + causality checks

math.implication: Fast relaxation to M then slow drift along M when ε≪1 and M attracting.
